meanings.definition: An arrangement where a group of people travel together in a single vehicle, typically to work or school.
meanings.sent1: Every morning, the neighbors organize a carpool to get to the office.
meanings.sent2: I joined a carpool with my classmates to save money on gas.
meanings.sent3: The carpool to the library turned into a fun chat session.
meanings.sent4: In the carpool of life, we all share the same road.
meanings.sent5: The carpool arrangement made commuting much more enjoyable.

meanings.definition: To participate in a carpool by sharing a ride with others.
meanings.sent1: We decided to carpool to the concert to save on parking fees.
meanings.sent2: Let's carpool to the game tomorrow to reduce traffic congestion.
meanings.sent3: I always feel like a team player when I carpool with my colleagues.
meanings.sent4: Carpooling with friends can make the journey more social and fun.
meanings.sent5: She agreed to carpool with her neighbor to the event.

meanings.definition: The act of sharing a car journey with others, typically to reduce costs or environmental impact.
meanings.sent1: Carpooling is a great way to save money on gas and reduce emissions.
meanings.sent2: The school organized a carpool for students living in the same area.
meanings.sent3: The carpool for the picnic ended up being a mini road trip.
meanings.sent4: Joining a carpool can be a small step towards a greener planet.
meanings.sent5: The carpool arrangement helped cut down on individual driving expenses.
